rect.style: fill: light-dark(#ffffff, var(--ge-dark-color, #121212)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 558px; height: 1px; padding-top: 30px; margin-left: 24px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: Astro is the web framework for building content-driven websites having minimal user interaction like blogs

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 408px; height: 1px; padding-top: 140px; margin-left: 201px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Island architecture:
- Page is divided into smaller island.
- Each island has its own js, hydration and server rendering
- Each island is separate, although they can share data and communicate
- better performance, better debugging

rect.style: fill: light-dark(#ffffff, var(--ge-dark-color, #121212)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));

div.div:
Client island:
- Interactive UI component that is hydrated on client side

div.div:
Server island (Default):
- Renders on server and HTML & CSS is returned
- Return no JS
